properties.name: Abingdon Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterAbingdon and District Camera Club has been in existence for more than 30 years and has had a variety of meeting places. Currently we meet on alternate Thursdays in the Methodist Church Hall, Dorchester Crescent, off Appleford Drive, in Abingdon, (behind the Boundary House Pub) where there is a handy bus-stop. Meetings commence at 7.45pm and finish at around 10.00pm. Our programme features a variety of items and the Club endeavours to accommodate all types of photographic medium. Compact, SLR, Large Format, Digital Camera Users are all welcome. If you want to find out more about us, why not come along to one or two of our meetings. There is no charge for the first two meetings.

properties.name: Amersham Photographic Society
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterYou\'re most welcome to visit us on Mondays at 7.45pm from September to May. No advance notification is necessary but do please introduce yourself to a Committee Member so that we can make you feel welcome - no-one enjoys Lonely Visitor syndrome! Meetings are held in: The Barn Hall Amersham Community Centre Chiltern Avenue Amersham Buckinghamshire The Barn Hall is the brick and timber building shown, next to the swimming pool.

properties.name: Aylesbury Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterMeetings The Southcourt Community Center Prebendal Avenue Aylesbury, Bucks. HP21 8LF. United Kingdom second and fourth Thursday at 7.45pm (for 8pm) unless otherwise stated

properties.name: Banbury Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterHow to find Us In the winter we normally meet at our new venue Chenderit School Middleton Cheney. This excellent facility provides us with full access to darkroom facilities and a number of digital imaging workstations. This provides amble opportunity to share skills, ideas and collective experience. We meet on Monday evenings at 7.30pm.

properties.name: Buckingham Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterCome and join us: The Buckingham Camera Club was formed in 1979 out of a desire to promote photography in the Buckingham and Winslow areas. The club now numbers 50 photographers with many and varied specialities: aviation, natural history, digital imaging, darkroom printing, special effects, table-top, portrait, landscape still-life, figure studies, candid and abstract - you name it and we have a member involved in it. The Club is a member of the Milton Keynes Photographic Alliance (MKPA) and is affiliated to the Photographic Alliance of Great Britain (PAGB) through the Chilterns Association of Camera Clubs (CACC). This gives us access to speakers and judges from a wide geographical area and enables us to participate in competitions in which we often score highly.

properties.name: Chesham Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterChesham Camera Club welcomes new members, whether experienced photographers or beginners. The club meets on Tuesday evenings from September to May, at the White Hill centre. New members are welcome to attend a few meetings without charge, before deciding to join.

properties.name: Chiltern Society Photogroup
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterWelcome to The Chiltern Society PhotoGroup. We aim to maintain a pictorial record of the Chilterns as it was and is now. This provides an invaluable record of the special character, qualities and amenities of the area. The PhotoGroup\'s library already has thousands of photographs and more are continually being added. Since the PhotoGroup was established in 1995 we have received several bequests of photograph collections; we should be delighted to accept more donations showing the Chiltern scene. We hold indoor meetings at the Amersham Community Centre in Chiltern Ave, Amersham new town. Free parking is available at weekends in the nearby Council Offices car park to the south of the Centre on the south side of King George V Road. You are welcome to join in our photographic activities; you donâ€™t need to be a member. Come to our informal morning meetings that usually reflect the photographic work we are doing in the Chilterns and see how you like our very non-camera club style. We welcome newcomers and hope that you will enjoy the social side of our meetings as much as the pictures you see.

properties.name: Croxley Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterThe Camera Club meets most Wednesday evenings September-April at St Oswald\'s Church Hall in Croxley Green, Hertfordshire. We are a friendly club and extend a warm welcome to visitors and prospective members.

properties.name: Ealing & Hampshire House Photographic Society
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterEHHPS welcomes all potential new members. We are a very friendly and extremely sociable group of around 40 members, whose common interest in photography has brought us together. The majority of the club members are amateur photographers although some members do earn a little extra through their skills in photography and digital imaging. As well as a full 12 month programme of entertainment, the Society produces a members Magazine, titled \'Click!\'. VENUE The Society generally meets on regular Thursday evenings, 8.00pm at Ealing Town Hall, New Broadway, Ealing W5 2BY. CAR PARK - There is a large (Free) car park at the rear of the Town Hall, the entrance to which is on Longfield Avenue. TUBE AND BUS - Ealing Town Hall is just a short walk from Ealing Broadway Tube station - Central & District lines, and is directly on the route of the 207 bus.

properties.name: Oxford Photographic Society
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterWe meet most Tuesday evenings in the City of Oxford Silver Band Hall , Temple Road, Cowley, Oxford.

properties.name: The Chalfonts and Gerrards Cross Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterAnyone interested in photography of any type is most welcome to come along to any meeting of the Camera Club at the Gerrards Cross Memorial Centre (click here for the Location) to get to know us and have an enjoyable evening. We convene every Wednesday in the Bar from about 19:30 for the meeting starting at 20:00.

properties.name: Wantage Camera Club
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterWe meet every Tuesday at 7:30pm in the Methodist Hall in Newbury St, and new members are always welcome. We run a varied programme of lectures, competitions and instructional evenings, including demonstrations of new digital technology. Details of the current programme and other activities can be found on the website. The Club also has flourishing Digital and Audio Visual Groups to cater for these popular branches of photography. We cater for all standards of photography, and beginners are particularly welcome. If you\'ve got a digital camera and would like to make better use of it, please come along to one of our meetings!

properties.name: Witney Photo Group
properties.description: Posted by CaccwebmasterGallery Room of the Corn Exchange, Market Square, Witney on Monday evenings at 7.30 pm.
